TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: told by Giłgiław of Vałulu village

S.FORM: aitsu a patjara penalisi izua maretimałimałi, łakua tjara liaw a mamamaw.
aico a patjara penalisi izoa maretimaljimalji, ljakoa tjara liaw a mamamaw.
S.TRANSL: As for taboos, there are different ones (in different villages), but certainly many are the same.

S.FORM: aitsu nu tjemugut, palisi a masi załum a namasi vusam.
aico no tjemogot, palisi a masi zaljom a namasi vosam.
S.TRANSL: When we sow grain it is taboo for the person carrying the seed to carry water.

S.FORM: sika mapuqasaqasaw aya.
sika mapoqasaqasaw aya.
S.TRANSL: It is said to cause the ear to have no grain.

S.FORM: qau nu kivaqu anga palisi a kivinkatan aya.
qao no kivaqo anga palisi a kivinkatan aya.
S.TRANSL: And when we are harvesting millet it is taboo to touch herbage in the forest(?).

S.FORM: sikisaqałaqałay aya.
sikisaqaljaqaljay aya.
S.TRANSL: It portends a plague (of rodents, etc.).

S.FORM: palisi a djemavats tua kakivaquin aya.
palisi a djemavac toa kakivaqoin aya.
S.TRANSL: It is taboo to walk through a millet field being harvested, they say.

S.FORM: inika sikaładjeładjek aya.
inika sikaljadjeljadjek aya.
S.TRANSL: It won’t have dew (and won’t be a good harvest).

S.FORM: palisi a masi pariuk nu namasi vusam itjen.
palisi a masi pariok no namasi vosam itjen.
S.TRANSL: When we are carrying seed it is taboo to carry a wok.

S.FORM: sika mapuqiduqidung aya.
sika mapoqidoqidong aya.
S.TRANSL: They say the grain will go black like charcoal.

S.FORM: nu uri tjemugut itjen, palisi a kiqaqivuan tua tjuḍalian.
no ori tjemogot itjen, palisi a kiqaqivoan toa tjodralian.
S.TRANSL: When we are going to sow grain it is taboo to talk to people expecting a baby.

S.FORM: nu palisilisi itjen palisi a pakisapuy, ayatua nasi aitsu a sapuy nu misepi itjen.
no palisilisi itjen palisi a pakisapoy, ayatoa nasi aico a sapoy no misepi itjen.
S.TRANSL: When we are observing religious rites it is taboo to give someone a light, because fire represents breath/life when we dream.

S.FORM: nu venułuq itjen a pasa vukivukid, vułuqen itjen nua tsemas aya.
no venoljoq itjen a pasa vokivokid, voljoqen itjen noa cemas aya.
S.TRANSL: When we throw something towards the woods, the spirits throw things at us, we are told.

S.FORM: nu keman itjen i vukivukid, nu i dedet itjen tua vukivukid, palisi a ika padjalian.
no keman itjen i vokivokid, no i dedet itjen toa vokivokid, palisi a ika padjalian.
S.TRANSL: When we eat in the woods, when we are near the woods, it is taboo not to give an offering to the spirits.

S.FORM: kilingułan itjen.
kilingoljan itjen.
S.TRANSL: They will sit and eat with us.

S.FORM: nu sekuliłan itjen nu kemakan itjen, tjara izua matsay a matsidił aya.
no sekoliljan itjen no kemakan itjen, tjara izoa macay a macidilj aya.
S.TRANSL: If we are ‘tripped’ (by a bird calling(?) to us) when we are eating, it is said that someone will certainly die.

S.FORM: palisi a vaqesingan nu sema vavua itjen, nu uri sema tua namatsay itjen.
palisi a vaqesingan no sema vavoa itjen, no ori sema toa namacay itjen.
S.TRANSL: It is taboo to sneeze when we are going to the fields or when we are going to where someone has died.

S.FORM: tja sikasaqetjuqetju aya.
tja sikasaqetjoqetjo aya.
S.TRANSL: It is said it will mean sickness.

S.FORM: nu kaqułisan itjen, inika sitsiketsikel nu sema dedet itjen, nu ika tjen a mavunglay.
no kaqoljisan itjen, inika sicikecikel no sema dedet itjen, no ika tjen a mavonglay.
S.TRANSL: When things are the wrong way round (when the kirkir sings before the tsugaw bird), it doesn’t cause us to go back if we are just going a short distance; or if we aren’t expecting a child.

S.FORM: łakua a mavunglay katua uri sema tsadja a uri kiqetsi, palisi aravats.
ljakoa a mavonglay katoa ori sema cadja a ori kiqeci, palisi aravac.
S.TRANSL: But if we are expecting a child or going some distance to fight, it is a serious taboo.

S.FORM: tja sika tjaparuparut.
tja sika tjaparoparot.
S.TRANSL: We will come off worst.

S.FORM: nu saqetju itjen, matu qinułis itjen tua tja siselapay aya.
no saqetjo itjen, mato qinoljis itjen toa tja siselapay aya.
S.TRANSL: If we are ill, our suffering will be severe, as if we were turned inside out.

S.FORM: palisi uta a patsugavan nu semainu anga itjen.
palisi ota a pacogavan no semaino anga itjen.
S.TRANSL: It is a bad omen if the tsugaw bird sings wherever we are going.

S.FORM: tja sika lułalułay, tja sika malaylaylay nu saqetju itjen.
tja sika loljaloljay, tja sika malaylaylay no saqetjo itjen.
S.TRANSL: We will be tired. If we are ill, our illness will be long drawn out.

S.FORM: palisi uta a pakełisan.
palisi ota a pakeljisan.
S.TRANSL: It is a bad omen if the kełis bird sings.

S.FORM: tja sipatsatsay i djalan, tja sipagerigerits tua nemanemanga aya.
tja sipacacay i djalan, tja sipagerigeric toa nemanemanga aya.
S.TRANSL: They say someone will die on the track, or we will have some grief to scream about.

S.FORM: nu alapen a tja itung nua qayaqayam, palisi aravats.
no alapen a tja itong noa qayaqayam, palisi aravac.
S.TRANSL: If our clothes are taken by a bird, that is a very bad omen.

S.FORM: sipatsatsay ta qała aya.
sipacacay ta qalja aya.
S.TRANSL: They say we will be killed by our enemies.

S.FORM: palisi a qinułivanglaw a qadaw.
palisi a qinoljivanglaw a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: It is a bad omen when there is a halo round the sun (when the sun is “rainbow-ed”).

S.FORM: sipatsatsay nua mamazangiłan aya.
sipacacay noa mamazangiljan aya.
S.TRANSL: It means a chieftain will die.

S.FORM: aitsu nu sema tjai viri tua djalan a sisił a qatjuvi, qemtseng aya, saka palisi a puarut a sema vavua a sema tjuqała.
aico no sema tjai viri toa djalan a sisilj a qatjovi, qemceng aya, saka palisi a poarot a sema vavoa a sema tjoqalja.
S.TRANSL: If a quaker-thrush or a snake goes across the track from right to left, it is said to be blocked; and it is taboo to go straight to the fields or to another village.

S.FORM: łakua nu tja teqitsen azua qatjuvi, sa tja pasa tjai viri, inika palisi.
ljakoa no tja teqicen azoa qatjovi, sa tja pasa tjai viri, inika palisi.
S.TRANSL: But if we use a stick to flip the snake over to the right and we pass it to the left it is not taboo.

S.FORM: aitsu a qayaqayam nu tja vułuqen a pasa navał saka sema tjai navał, inika palisi uta.
aico a qayaqayam no tja voljoqen a pasa navalj saka sema tjai navalj, inika palisi ota.
S.TRANSL: As for the birds, if we throw things to make them go to the right and they go to the right, it isn’t taboo to go on.

S.FORM: palisi a lemaketsuł tua mamazangiłan.
palisi a lemakecolj toa mamazangiljan.
S.TRANSL: It is taboo to walk over the limb of a chieftain.

S.FORM: sikakalakala aya.
sikakalakala aya.
S.TRANSL: It is said to cause arthritis.

S.FORM: palisi petsungu tua tsuqu a kasiw.
palisi pecongo toa coqo a kasiw.
S.TRANSL: It is taboo to use the bischoffia tree for firewood.

S.FORM: sikaḍaquḍaquł.
sikadraqodraqolj.
S.TRANSL: It causes goitre.

S.FORM: palisi a tsemułu a mavunglay tua qatsang.
palisi a cemoljo a mavonglay toa qacang.
S.TRANSL: It is taboo for someone expecting a baby to butcher a pig.

S.FORM: sikamapuqatsaqatsang aya.
sikamapoqacaqacang aya.
S.TRANSL: They say it causes epilepsy.

S.FORM: palisi a qemtsi tua qemuzimuzip anga.
palisi a qemci toa qemozimozip anga.
S.TRANSL: It is also taboo for them to kill any animal.

S.FORM: sipatsatsay aya.
sipacacay aya.
S.TRANSL: They say it will cause a death.

S.FORM: palisi a semenay nu tsavił anga tua puałak.
palisi a semenay no cavilj anga toa poaljak.
S.TRANSL: It is taboo to sing a year after a birth.

S.FORM: siqauqaung aya.
siqaoqaong aya.
S.TRANSL: They say the child will be a cry-baby.

S.FORM: palisi a kemzekez a venengetj uta.
palisi a kemzekez a venengetj ota.
S.TRANSL: It is taboo for someone expecting a baby to nail or tie something.

S.FORM: sikapazangazangal nu puałak aya.
sikapazangazangal no poaljak aya.
S.TRANSL: They say it will lead to a difficult birth.
